Instrument.name: Energetic Particle and Plasma Spectrometer Fast Imaging Plasma Spectrometer for MESSENGER
Instrument.description: The Energetic Particle Spectrometer (EPS) is part of the MESSENGER system, which includes the Fast Imaging Plasma Spectrometer (FIPS) designed by the University of Michigan. FIPS measures the distributions and composition of magnetosphere ions in the energy range of < 50 eV/q to 20 keV/q, with a processing throughput of 5 kHz. It employs an electrostatic analyzer (ESA), a post-acceleration chamber, and a time-of-flight (TOF) telescope to analyze ions based on their mass-to-charge ratio, energy, and incident angle. FIPS generates 48-bit raw event packets, which are sent to the EPPS system, delivering up to 50,000 events per second. The EPPS software compiles a mass distribution spectrum and energy spectra for particles, supporting telemetry output and recording of heavy-ion energy images.
